subject: Junit4 with command line
msgSnippet: Here is tests with the new version of Junit4 import junit.framework.JUnit4TestAdapter; import junit.framework.TestCase; import org.junit.Test; public class
messageBody:
Here is tests with the new version of Junit4

import junit.framework.JUnit4TestAdapter;
import junit.framework.TestCase;
import org.junit.Test;

public class AdditionTest extends TestCase {

private int x = 1;
private int y = 1;

@Test public void testAddition() {
int z = x + y;
assertEquals(2, z);
}

@Test public void countOne() {
assertEquals(1, 1);
}

static public junit.framework.Test suite() {
return new JUnit4TestAdapter(AdditionTest.class);
}

}

Run on command line:
java -classpath .;..\lib\junit4.jar org.junit.runner.JUnitCore
AdditionTest

Output:
Core AdditionTest
JUnit version 4.0rc1
.
Time: 0,015

OK (1 test)

As you've seen only the test testAddition is recognised and executed,
the other test countOne could not be recognised.

I tried to run within eclipse, both tests are recognised and executed.
I've changed the countOne to testCountOne, then the test testCountOne
works on the command line as well. What have I done wrong with the
command line? Please help. Thanks in advance.
